# Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in B (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is a four-note sequence consisting of the root note, minor third, perfect fifth, and major seventh (1-b3-5-7). In the key of B with the shape of G, this arpeggio is built on the notes B, D, F#, and A.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root Note)
- D (Minor Third)
- F# (Perfect Fifth)
- A (Major Seventh)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is commonly used in jazz music to create a sense of tension and release. It has a sophisticated and jazzy sound that can add color and complexity to chord progressions. The inclusion of the major seventh interval gives this arpeggio a unique and slightly dissonant quality, adding an element of intrigue to musical compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the Minor Major 7th arpeggio in B (Shape: G):
1. **"Autumn Leaves" by Joseph Kosma** - This jazz standard features the Minor Major 7th arpeggio in various sections, showcasing its versatility and emotional depth.
2. **"Blue Bossa" by Kenny Dorham** - In this Latin jazz classic, the Minor Major 7th arpeggio is used to create a smooth and sophisticated harmonic backdrop.
3. **"Someday My Prince Will Come" by Frank Churchill** - This Disney classic incorporates the Minor Major 7th arpeggio in a whimsical and enchanting manner, highlighting its evocative and dreamy quality.
